title: How to Fix the "Device Not Managed" Error in Network Manager

steps.title: Open up the terminal.
steps.content: Open up the terminal. This can be done by pressing Ctrl + Alt + T . Then type in the following command: gksu gedit /etc/NetworkManager/NetworkManager.conf You will be required to give an administrative password.

steps.title: Edit the NetworkManager.conf file.
steps.content: Edit the NetworkManager.conf file. In the last line, replace the managed=false to managed=true . Then save the file and exit the editor.

steps.title: Restart your PC or the Network Manager.
steps.content: Restart your PC or the Network Manager. If you don't want to restart your PC, then give the terminal this command: sudo restart network-manager .
